results.loot: Loot has been gathered and added to the stash.
results.lootFoundDiscount: Found ship parts! You get a discount of {amount} credits on your next ship component purchase.
results.finds: The battlefield has been searched for useful items.
results.invasionAverted: The invasion threat was averted for now.

galacticWar.lost: {planetName} has been lost to Unity and can no longer be visited.
galacticWar.contested: The fight for {planetName} remains contested. No progress was made.
galacticWar.makingGround: Ground has been made on {planetName}! Future progress rolls will have a bonus.
galacticWar.liberated: Victory! {planetName} has been liberated from Unity.

injuries.title: Injuries & Recovery
injuries.description: Any character that became a casualty must roll on the Injury Table.
injuries.dead: Dead. All carried equipment is damaged.
injuries.crippling_wound: Crippling wound. Requires {cost} credits of surgery immediately, or suffer a permanent -1 to a stat.
injuries.light_wound: Light wound. Will recover in {recoveryTurns} turn(s).
injuries.cripplingWoundPrompt: Choose an outcome for the crippling wound (cost: {cost}cr):

upgrades.stalkerTeleportTooltip: Improve Teleport distance by +1". Costs {cost} XP. Can be taken twice.

training.title: Advanced Training
training.description: You may now invest credits and XP into advanced training courses for your crew. The application fee is 1 credit.
training.approved: Application Approved! You may now enroll a crew member in a course.
training.denied: Application Denied. The instructors are not impressed. Try again next turn.

character_event.title: Character Event
character_event.description: Select a crew member to experience a random event.

characterEvents.1-3: {name} is depressed by the violence and refuses to fight next turn, granting the crew +1 Story Point.
characterEvents.4-6: {name} has business elsewhere and is unavailable for two turns. They return with {xp} XP and a new item.
characterEvents.7-10: {name} makes some local friends and earns +1 XP.
characterEvents.11-12: {name} wonders if it's time to move on. If in Sick Bay, they might leave the crew.
characterEvents.13-15: {name} gets a letter from home, earning +1 XP and possibly a new Quest.
characterEvents.16-19: {name} argues with the crew and will not perform any tasks next turn, but will still fight.
characterEvents.20-23: {name} gets in a scrap with another crew member. One of them will end up in Sick Bay.
characterEvents.24-26: {name} is enjoying the local food. If in Sick Bay, recovery is reduced by one turn. Otherwise, +1 XP.
characterEvents.27-29: {name} has a change of heart and adopts a new motivation.
characterEvents.30-33: {name} decides it's time for a make-over! This change is purely cosmetic.
characterEvents.34-38: {name} overhears something useful, gaining the crew 1 Quest Rumor.
characterEvents.39-41: {name} earns a little on the side, gaining +{credits} credits.
characterEvents.42-45: {name} has a heart-to-heart talk with {otherName}. Both earn +1 XP.
characterEvents.46-48: Time spent exercising is never wasted. {name} earns +{xp} XP.
characterEvents.49-51: {name} picks up an unusual hobby, granting the crew +1 Story Point.
characterEvents.52-55: The scars tell the story. If {name} was injured recently, they earn +2 XP.
characterEvents.56-59: {name} has had time to reflect on their adventures, earning +{xp} XP.
characterEvents.60-62: {name} has made a real personal breakthrough, increasing a base ability score by +1.
characterEvents.63-66: {name} gets hurt while working on the ship, spending one campaign turn in Sick Bay. The ship takes 1 Hull damage.
characterEvents.67-68: {name} has finally found true love in this bleak universe, granting the crew +1 Story Point.
characterEvents.69-71: A personal enemy has tracked {name} down. The crew gains a new Rival.
characterEvents.72-75: Someone has sent {name} a gift. The crew found: {loot}!
characterEvents.76-78: {name} feels great! The next time they would roll on the Injury Table, the roll is ignored.
characterEvents.79-82: {name} knows someone who knows someone. The crew gains a new Patron.
characterEvents.83-84: {name} seems to be leading a charmed existence, gaining +1 Luck.
characterEvents.85-87: {name} has put in a lot of hard work. The ship is repaired for 2 Hull Points.
characterEvents.88-91: They don’t make them like they used to. A random item carried by {name} is damaged.
characterEvents.92-94: Where did it go? A random item carried by {name} has been lost, but might turn up again.
characterEvents.95-97: A deep feeling of melancholy afflicts {name}, who will earn no XP next turn.
characterEvents.98-100: {name} has had a lot of time to burn and may perform an additional action next turn.

campaignEvents.1-3: You’ve met a friendly doc who doesn’t ask too many questions.
campaignEvents.1-3_effect: Select up to two crew members in Sick Bay to reduce their Recovery time by one campaign turn each.
campaignEvents.4-8: The life support system on the ship needs upgrading badly.
campaignEvents.4-8_effect: The ship cannot be flown until {cost} credits are paid for repairs.
campaignEvents.9-12: A chance meeting turns into a new ally.
campaignEvents.9-12_effect: A new character has been generated. You may add them to the crew or gain +1 story point.
campaignEvents.13-16: You’ve made friends among the locals.
campaignEvents.17-20: You managed to mouth off to the wrong people.
campaignEvents.17-20_effect: A new Rival has been added.
campaignEvents.21-23: An old nemesis has tracked you down.
campaignEvents.21-23_effect: A persistent Rival has appeared. They will follow you from planet to planet.
campaignEvents.24-26: A shady character offers you a deal.
campaignEvents.24-26_effect: Give him any one item of equipment, then roll on the Trade Table (p.79).
campaignEvents.27-30: You sell off some cargo you acquired on the last planet.
campaignEvents.31-35: One of the crew overheard something interesting.
campaignEvents.36-38: You’ve managed to settle some old “business”.
campaignEvents.36-38_effect: If you have any, you may remove one Rival of your choice. If you have no Rivals, your captain earns +1 XP instead.
campaignEvents.39-41: An admirer wants to come along.
campaignEvents.39-41_effect: Gain a new crew member, if desired. They have only the base profile with no extra rolls, and bring no equipment. If your crew has any Feral members, the new member is also Feral.
campaignEvents.42-44: An alien merchant offers you some strange device.
campaignEvents.42-44_effect: If you want to buy it, pay 4 credits and then roll on the Loot Table.
campaignEvents.45-48_effect: If there are any items in your Stash, a random item is damaged and must be Repaired.
campaignEvents.49-51: You’ve earned a bit of a bad reputation.
campaignEvents.49-51_effect: If you know any Patrons on the current world, randomly select one that will no longer work with you. If you have no Patrons, shrug and move on.
campaignEvents.52-56: The tax man is taking an interest in your business conduct.
campaignEvents.52-56_effect: Roll 2D6 and pay the higher die in credits. If you have insufficient credits your ship is impounded until you can pay.
campaignEvents.57-59: The crew has decided it’s time for a new person to be in charge.
campaignEvents.57-59_effect: Select a crew member to be the new captain. They immediately receive 3 XP. Roll 1D6. On a 1, the old captain leaves the campaign permanently, taking any items carried with them. If your crew has any K’Erin, one of them must be selected, or they will leave.
campaignEvents.60-63_effect: Add a new Patron to the list of those known.
campaignEvents.64-66: Recent events made for a good learning opportunity.
campaignEvents.67-70: During routine maintenance, the gravitational adjuster got knocked out of alignment.
campaignEvents.67-70_effect: Your ship suffers 1D6 points of Hull Point damage.
campaignEvents.71-74: The crew spends a night drinking, watching movies, and playing cards.
campaignEvents.75-78: You meet up with an old arms dealer contact who owes you a deal.
campaignEvents.75-78_effect: Add your choice of 3 weapons from the following list: Hand Cannons, Military Rifles, Shotguns, or Machine Pistols.
campaignEvents.79-81_effect: If you currently owe money, reduce your debt by 1D6+1 credits. If you owe nothing, earn 2 credits for being prudent with your money.
campaignEvents.82-84: The sector news networks are awash with rumors of war.
campaignEvents.82-84_effect: While you remain on this planet, any roll for Invasion is at +2.
campaignEvents.85-88: A bit of time on your hands.
campaignEvents.85-88_effect: The crew has a few days to do their own thing. Select two crew members at random and have each make a roll on the Exploration Table (p.80).
campaignEvents.89-91: You got noticed by someone you’d rather avoid.
campaignEvents.89-91_effect: Add a Rival. If you currently are on a Quest, the next campaign turn is automatically a battle against the new Rival, and they will add +1 to the number of enemies.
campaignEvents.92-94_effect: Whatever you did, every campaign turn you stay on this planet, you must add an additional Rival.
campaignEvents.95-97: Unity government says no ships are authorized to leave.
campaignEvents.95-97_effect: You cannot leave the planet during the next two campaign turns.
campaignEvents.98-100: In hindsight, it’ll make a great story.
campaignEvents.98-100_effect: Select a crew member who was a casualty last battle. They receive +1 Luck. If nobody got hurt, receive +1 story point instead.
